name: Superficial Femoral Artery Stenosis
chief_complaint: My left leg hurts when I walk, but it goes away when I rest
prognosis: Good with early intervention, may progress to critical limb ischemia if untreated
description: Narrowing of the superficial femoral artery causing reduced blood flow to the lower extremity, typically due to atherosclerosis. Most common location for peripheral arterial disease in lower limbs.
